comment.author: 75987015@N03
comment._content: The loss of life in WW2 defies belief but WW1 is so heartbreakingly tragic. That King and country call to arms signified the end of an age that is gone forever...or has it?

comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
CWGC has this additional information:

Of Stockbriggs, Lesmahagow, Lanarkshire. Only son of Catherine Thomson (now of Largs, Ayrshire) and the late William Thomson.

comment.author: 75534960@N06
comment._content:
From my own personal experience Soldering is a noble profession and always will be.
Solders always believe they will survive whatever is happening around them,
During periods of active service ie Afghanistan, Iraq et al the British armed forces have a surge of recruits wanting to see action.
It will never change.
However my deffinition of war is 'A total failure of politicians to find a peaceful solution'.
Regards
JDW
